intro: Erigeron cuatrocienegensis, commonly known as the four-leaf cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its foliage is usually grayish-green with hairy surfaces, aiding in water conservation.
